description: From Arabic فَتْوَى‎ (fatwā, “formal legal opinion”), the verbal noun of أَفْتَى‎ (ʔaftā, “to deliver a formal opinion”). مُفْتٍ‎ (muftin, “mufti”) is the active participle of the same verb.

entries.meaning: (Islam) A legal opinion, decree or ruling issued by a mufti or other Islamic lawyer.
examples: I think the fatwas on that website are totally unreliable.

verbs.description: fatwa (third-person singular simple present fatwas, present participle fatwaing, simple past and past participle fatwaed)

entries.meaning: (rare, transitive) To make somebody the subject of a fatwa, especially a ban or death sentence.
